page.title: 10FOLK CUSTOMS
page.content:
Many people believe that there is a gypsy buried under a boulder in County Lane. The gypsy got there because Albrighton didn't have a magistrate and criminals would cross the county line to escape the law.Two gypsies fought,one killed the other and was later buried there.A boulder was placed on the grave to mark the spot. We have been told that beneath the boulder bunches of wild flowers may still be found.
There is also an Albrighton fair. The rose queen leads a procession of floats through the village to a large field at the end of the High Street where we have stalls and arena events. Originally the fair was held in a field in Station Road. The field is now a housing estate.
